text.__SUMMARY__: Vipera eriwanensis, commonly known as the Alburzi viper or the Armenian steppe viper, is a species of venomous snake of the family Viperidae.
text.Subspecies:
There are two recognized subspecies:
Vipera eriwanensis ebneri Knoepffler & Sochurek, 1955
Vipera eriwanensis eriwanensis (Reuss, 1933)
text.Geographic range:
The snake is found in Armenia, northwestern Iran and northeastern Turkey.
